image.altText: A man in a charcoal suit and glasses stands speaking behind a podium on a stage.

props.synopsis: The 2025 ACT Labor conference sees optimism about the party's achievements along with concern about the issues the public health system is facing.

title.children: ACT chief minister calls for more federal health funding

image.altText: a dark clouds covers the skyline of birdsville in queensland

props.synopsis: There are multiple indications the record drought across southern Australia is finally loosening its grip.

title.children: Most widespread rain in two years for southern Australia, with more to come

image.altText: A colourful photographic installation with one image of a man and one of a woman in the centre, with collages on either side.

props.synopsis: The minds behind iconic fashion house Romance Was Born, Anna Plunkett and Luke Sales, are the focus of a new photographic installation at the National Portrait Gallery in Canberra.Â

title.children: Gallery installation pays tribute to Aussie fashion house loved by celebs

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The court heard the Canberra man, who admitted putting spyware on a woman's phone, denied it when she asked if he had and told her she was paranoid.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for stalking woman, putting spyware on her phone

image.altText: A school sign on the exterior of a large modern building.

props.synopsis: The administrators of Brindabella Christian College in Canberra's north say the school spent hundreds of thousands of dollars on a robot dog and an overseas trip while it may have been insolvent.

title.children: Brindabella Christian College likely insolvent from 2021: report

image.altText: A student with dark hair and a blue jumper in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Canberra experienced the slowest quarterly growth in rental values in the country, and the lowest 12-month increase in rent prices for units.

title.children: 'Absurd': Rentals sit vacant at home but here Gabriel can't find one

image.altText: A smartly dressed woman with short hair leaves a court building next to a man in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: The ACT Integrity Commission levels findings of "serious corrupt conduct" against two former Canberra Institute of Technology (CIT) officials over the handling of a controversial $5 million contract.

title.children: CIT officials' actions amounted to 'serious corrupt conduct': watchdog

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The acting justice acknowledged the accused's troubled childhood and recommended that rehabilitation be considered in his sentencing.

title.children: Judge says village responsible for raising car thief 'failed him'

image.altText: A press shot of INXS in the '80s adorned with graphic design of Australian flora.

props.synopsis: Scoring film, TV, sporting events and deeply personal moments, INXS's tender ballad has stood the test time. Now, it's been voted as Australia's hottest song of all time.

title.children: INXS wins the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs

image.altText: Missile shoots into the sky in a remote area

props.synopsis:
The Australian Army has test-fired its new Precision Strike Missile for the first time from a remote training base, with the defence industry minister saying the new weapon will be a powerful deterrent to potential adversaries.

Â

title.children: Australia tests new long-range missile capable of hitting targets 500km away

image.altText: A woman, man and young son.

props.synopsis: Australians are defying a global downturn in travel to the United States, with new figures showing a rise in visitor numbers, despite Donald Trump's tough new border controls.

title.children: Trump's tough border stance isn't deterring some Australian tourists

image.altText: Lindy Lucena

props.synopsis: Lindy Lucena was beaten to death by her abusive partner. Her family and friends believe she could still be alive today if police had responded with greater urgency â and the police watchdog has concerns too.

title.children: Police took almost an hour to respond to fatal bashing woman

image.altText: 5 men

props.synopsis: Years of speculation followed the case â but after revived investigations amid reports Hockey Canada used players' registration fees to pay sexual abuse settlements, it was reopened and made public.

image.altText: Harry Wilson upset after Wallabies' loss to Lions.

title.children: 'Gutted' Wallabies fuming after contentious late call in Lions Test loss

image.altText: An NT Police car parked on the street.

props.synopsis: A teenager is in serious condition after he was stabbed at the Royal Darwin Show, with the alleged offender in custody, police say.Â

title.children: Teenager in custody after alleged Darwin Show stabbing of another teenager

props.synopsis: Geelong skipper Patrick Dangerfield helps himself to a post-match meal after being subbed off against the Kangaroos, as Adelaide puts Port Adelaide to the sword in the second half of the Showdown.

title.children: Dangerfield eats mid-game kebab as Cats embarrass Roos, Crows hand Port record Showdown loss

image.altText: On a red background, blurred images of children can be seen. In the foreground, the word ADVANCE is printed

props.synopsis: Conservative lobby group Advance used unblurred images of children taken from the YouTube accounts of education organisations without their consent, an ABC NEWS Verify investigation has found.

title.children: Parents did not consent to children appearing in new Advance ad

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: I hope you've been hitting the books. We both know you needed it. Let's play, HARD!

title.children: I'm back to test your trivia skills. Have you used your time off wisely?

image.altText: A truck seen through a gap in road signs.

title.children: Drought relief truck convoy brings fodder to farms in time-honoured tradition

image.altText: Illustration of man using a computer with scam icons overhead

image.altText: Tevita Tatola lies injured on the ground during a South SYdney Rabbitohs NRL game.

image.altText: Two men shake hands.

props.synopsis: The United States has lifted sanctions on several allies of Myanmar's ruling generals and their military-linked companies in a move that has prompted concern from politicians and rights groups.

image.altText: Anthony Albanese G7

props.synopsis: The reality of the situation on the ground in Gaza, and the spectre of children dying of malnutrition or starvation, sits at such extraordinary odds with the language of spokespeople for both the Netanyahu government and the IDF.

title.children: The reality in Gaza shows Israel is at risk of becoming a global pariah

image.altText: people swimming in a natural swimming hole between boulders.

title.children: After 21 deaths at this tourism beauty spot, the community has had enough

image.altText: A screenshot of two people in an intimate embrace looking shocked

title.children: Paltrow becomes Astronomer's 'spokesperson' after Coldplay saga

image.altText: Basil Zempilas speaking at a press conference.

image.altText: A batter puts his hand up in a claw like a tiger and appears to growl.

props.synopsis: There are multiple indications the record drought across southern Australia is finally loosening its grip.

title.children: Most widespread rain in two years for southern Australia, with more to come

image.altText: Four actresses dressed as their characters pose for the camera against a black backdrop.

title.children: Who are these women and what have you done to Sex and the City?

image.altText: An historic photo of soldiers from world war one sitting in a trench.

image.altText: A pile of Australian and American money.

props.synopsis: The once almighty American dollar has been falling against almost every major currency ever since Donald Trump became the 47th US president.

title.children: Heading overseas? A strengthening Aussie dollar might not be good news

image.altText: hulk hogan flexes while wearing red tights and a yellow tanktop

title.children: How Hulk Hogan went from wrestling icon to right-wing mouthpiece
